text.p: GranCare Inc said Thursday it had restated its second-quarter and six-month earnings after making a change in its accounting estimate for the bad debt allowance for accounts receivables.
It said in a statement that it will put the change in its financial statements, which will be included in the quarterly filing on Form 10-Q for the second quarter ended June 30.
GranCare said it had adjusted its quarterly and six-month earnings, released on July 29, to reflect an $8 million charge.

"As previously announced, revenues for the second quarter ended June 30, 1997, exclusive of TeamCare's operations, increased $11 million, to $199 million from $188 million in the same period of 1996," it said.

"The adjusted net loss exclusive of TeamCare's operations was approximately $0.4 million, or $0.02 per share on a fully diluted basis, compared with net income of $3.7 million, or $0.15 per share, on a comparable basis for the same quarter a year ago," it said.

"As previously announced, revenues for the six months ended June 30, 1997, exclusive of TeamCare's operations, increased $37 million, to $403 million from $366 million in the same period of 1996," it said.

"Adjusted net income exclusive of TeamCare's operations, merger costs and extraordinary charges was $3.2 million, or $0.13 per share on a fully diluted basis, compared to $6.3 million, or $0.26 per share on a fully diluted basis, for the six months ended June 30, 1996," it said.
"Revenues and earnings (loss) per share were $424 million and ($1.11) per share versus $477 million and $0.61 per share for the first six months of 1997 and 1996, respectively," it said.
On July 29, the company reported a profit of $0.18 per share on revenues of $199.3 million for the second quarter against a profit of $0.33 on $247.3 million for the same period a year ago.
For the six-month period, it had a loss of $0.91 per share on revenues of $423.9 million against a profit $0.61 on $477.3 million a year ago.
GranCare, headquartered in Atlanta, is provides specialty medical and long-term care services in select markets.
